You are an experienced medical physician assisting with verbal autopsy analysis.
The provided data was collected from a field research centre in South Africa's rural northeast.

We will provide, for each case:

3) Estimate your confidence level in your answer as a percentage.

If the information is insufficient to determine a cause of death, explicitly state that in the output.

}
Do not add other keys or text.

Case ID: HLDPR

SYMPTOM DATA:
HDSS Name: Agincourt
Date of Birth: 1969-12-29
Date of Death: 2005-06-15
Sex: f
Did s(he) die during the dry season?: y
Was she female?: y

Was she married at the time of death?: y
Did the final illness last at least 3 weeks?: y

Please confirm: When she died, she was NEITHER pregnant NOR had recently been pregnant NOR had recently delivered when she died - is that right?: y
Did (s)he receive any treatment for the illness that led to death?: y
Did (s)he receive oral rehydration salts?: y
Did (s)he receive (or need) intravenous fluids (drip) treatment?: y
In the final days before death, was traditional medicine used?: y
Narrative: Deceased experienced a headache and afterwards started coughing.  Cooked guava leaves was prepared for her but cough continued.  Her body was hot sometimes experiencing chills.  She complained of chest pain.  She went to clinic treatment given but cough and pain continued.  Her body was hot sometimes experiencing chills.  She complained of chest pain.  She went to clinic, treatment given but cough and pain continued.  She consulted a private doctor but cough got worse.  She complained  of feeling pain on throat when she swallow food.  She went back to the private doctor, after diagnosed he said she developed sores on throat.  And also that she was dehydrated .  He took her to matikwana where he gave her water drips.  She started to vomit when taking food and afterwards diarrhoea started which was very liquid.  She started to loose weight and energy.  She became very weak she was unable to walk or d o anything.  After a week diarrhoea stopped.  Vomit also stopped.  She started to sweat heavily and finally passed away at home.

Please analyze this verbal autopsy case and provide your diagnosis.

Narrative: The deceased experienced chest  pain, taken to a traditional healer.He had some cuts from a razor blade smear medication. The illness show no improvement, he complained with lega proble. He went to Z.C.C, given tea to drink.Even he use treatment illness became worse. His legs/ stomuch/ hands and face became swollen. They consult a private doctor, there he was told he had wounds inside chest and his liver was damaged. He was given tablets, told to come for checkup after two weeks. He went for checkup, he was told that his liver was seriously damaged.Therefore he was given tablets after using treatment illness still not better. At middle of illness, he experienced difficult breathing. Even he used treatment from doctor illness was not better. He was taken to a traditional healer, medication was given.Towards death he vomitted water for three days. The day he died water came out from mouth and nose. He stayed two weeks at traditional healer then died.

Narrative: Since from birth the baby was looking healthy. At the age of two, the baby developed a rash on her head then taken to a traditional healer. Traditional medicine was given but illness seems not better. They also tried a faith healer where a prayer was done for her, and ZCC tea was given. Thereafter she was taken to clinic after examined, she was given medicine to heal rash. The baby also experienced cough as well as difficult breathing. The baby's condition was bad then taken to hospital. At hospital, she was examined after admitted for medication. While at hospital, the baby experienced diarrhoea and vomit. Her condition became worse but she was released from hospital after three weeks. The problem of diarrhoea and vomit was better. Afterwards difficult breathing became worse then the baby taken to clinic. At clinic referral letter was given to hospital. At hospital, she was examined after admitted for some few days. The baby was released from hospital being better  but taken to hospital monthly for checkup. Afterwards the baby's body became swollen and difficult breathing became worse then taken to hospital. At hospital, the baby was examined thereafter admitted but died the following day. The baby also experienced hot body but it was on and off. The baby was sweating a lot.

Then he change to matikwna to collect the very same pills.  In 1992 he had a car accident where e was taken to Matikwana but minor injury but he was also taken to a special Doctor Lisbon) and it was said by a Doctor that his chest was injured.  Taken back to Mapulaneng from Sabie hospital they told the family that the deceased must get injection everyday in the clinic but it was arranged that sister Baloyi of Lillydale clinic will treat him at home.  This was done until when he eat he vomited.  There appear wounds in his leg as if he was burnt but not the wound produce water clean).  Taken to clinic for bandage and at later stage he died.  The porridge was changed everyday by a male nurse from Lillydale clinic Mr. Lazarus Mathukane.

He to him about 3 week without helping him that problem.  They took him to another traditional healer at Somerset where he tried him also but he failed to cure it . Narrative: The deceased was not having any other illness except the stomachache that have cause the death. Since from '63 was just on and off about this problem. After eating the stomach will ache then he vomit. In January '94 he was taken to Tintswalo. He stayed there for one month. Treatment was tablets only and he was transferred to Letaba hospital. Treatment was to examine the cause of the illness and they found that the opstruction of the bowel was  block. Then he was given tablets and transferred him back to Tintswalo with a letter to transferred him to Pretoria. From Pretoria he gone under operation to solve the opstruction of bowel. He stay from the hospital for one week. He was fine and was discharged back to Tintswalo. Tablets was given too as a treatment. From Tinstwalo back home. So in January '95 he was walking in the plough field were he had fell down and his left side paralised. No more talking. Then he was taken to Tintswalo again. Treatment was tablets saying it is high blood. From there he could no longer walk every time sitting on chairs. He was taken back to Tintswalo again and treatment was still the same and they wrote a letter to explain that the  deceased can collect his tablets from the clinic. It was not better until when he have a diarrhoea for one week and finally die on the way to Mapulaneng hospital.

Narrative:  It was on a Good Friday and they hired a bakkie to Ireagh for a traditional dance.  So in the evening on their way home their car collided with another vehicle.  They were taken to Agincourt health centre and the injures were minon and he was the only one transferred to Tintswalo hospital.  In Tintswalo they said he is having mind injuries to his legs and waist.  Injuries in his waist was caused by Zincs of the bakkie and the bottles of the windscreen.  On Monday he was discharged.  He stayed for 5 days and the legs started to be painful.  It changed to green and he was returned to Tintswalo hospital.  In Tintswalo they took him to an X - ray to check whether he is not having any fracture.  They said he is not having fracture so they bandaged the whole legs with bandages from the toes till to the thighs.  So he was discharged but he was unable to walk.  So they hired a car to Barrington to inform his relatives.  So while in Belington a ZCC prophet told them that it is not a matter of an accident.  He her been witched.  He not die.  So he told them to go and buy ZCC tea to boil and drink and another on to wash the legs with cloth while still hot.  They did that and instead the legs became swollen more and more buy them he was no longer going out to the toilet.  His renal movement was fasterved and also his legs very painful that he cannot walk.  So after three days they took him to Matikwana hospital.  He was no longer eating and he was very ill by than.  In Matikwana they quarreled for having delayed to take him to health service but his husband explained the while process.  His legs were no longer having enough flash.  There were only bones and the legs were than having worms and smelling badly.  So in Matikwana  they tried to wash the legs with water and medicine.  Giving him tablets for pains and sleeping.  He was then talking nonsense and loosing consciousness.  So he spent two days and died on to third day.  NB.  He lost appetite and he was just forced to eat food.

When a new baby is born, there are certain  membranes that are removed from nostrils and mouth quickly after birth.  If these membrane cannot be removed baby got abnormal snoring, noisy difficult breathing.  If a baby cannot get treatment early might die.

Narrative: The deceased was well no sign of any other ill less. He was a traditional healer or Sangoma in his life. Firstly the deceased complained of paining bones and he could not walk for a long distance. The nerves of the leg more specially on the back of the knees was swollen and stiff. The paining of bones was for period two years. Since he was a healer he did try to cure himself but it invain. Even to his friends he had try but still the same. He never get better. Treatment was to be put on hot steam, drink medicine, Vaseline medicine to smear the legs. He did never get better. In 1993 he started to have cough and difficult breathing. Most of the time he was wetting himself himself because he was unable to walk due to illness. He was spitting sputum after cough and his urine was smelling too bad. He was sreaming when he urinates saying that uterus and kidneys are paining. Then he was taken to Tintswalo hospital. Most of the time he was receiving his treatment there. Treatment was tablets, drink medicine and the other one to rub on the hole body. He will stay for one week or two weeks and they discharged him. He will be better for some weeks or month and it starts again. Then he was taken to Agincourt clinic and treatment was still the same to Tintswalo. It was getting worse because he was very thin. So late 1993 he had a diarrhoea which was just twice per week and is off for the rest of days. When the diarrhoea is off he will have difficulties in releasing stools. The stools was small rounded like pf a goat. When the difficulties of releasing stools is off, the dirrhoea is on again. It was on and off about this problem. Then he was taken to the Agincourt clinic. Treatment was tablets, rub medicine and the other one to drink. Still there it was worse and they took him back to Agincourt clinic again. From the clinic he was transferred to Matikwane hospital. He stayed at the hospital for one month and he was discharged being ill. Treatment was still the same to Tintswalo and Agincourt clinic. It was more worse. It was on and off until middle 1994. So three days before death early in morning the deceased had spit froth. The suffocating was worse, eyes were sunken in and very thin. The froth was too much and they immediately hired a bakkie to take him to the hospital. Without any delay the bakkie had arrived and the drove to Tintswalo hospital. Treatment was still the same as before. He had stayed there for two days and on the following day he died.

At one stage he was given panado syrup and cough syrup only. His condition became bad that in 2002 he vomited a lot of blood and afterwards he cried once, then collapsed, showing tiredness.  He was then taken to a private doctor where he was given the same treatment he use to receive at Mapulaneng. He was supplemented with blood an water but unfortunately passed away.

At Mapulaneng hospital she had her piece of flesh cut off on the breast to be sent to Garankuwa hospital. When she went to mapulaneng for the results she was told she needed to undergo an operation because at Garankuwa the doctors could not established what was the nature of the disease. She declined on operation and later taken to the ZCC priest. During this period she was seriously complaining about the painful nature of the breast such that sometimes she was even screaming. The priest gave her ZCC tea but she didn't drink it. She later went to see the traditional doctors. Traditional medicine tried to improve the situation the breast can now releases dirty things mixed with blood. Because the pains could not disappear she went to the international Pentecost church for some prayers. It never helped until she died. She also had swollen legs when the disease became severe. She also complained about feeling like carrying a heavy burden on the shoulders. She was always sitting around the fire complaining about coldness. She spent almost a year within sleeping she was always sleeping while sited because she felt like losing oxygen when trying to sleep properly. As the result she had wounds around her buttocks. Towards death she was no longer walking nor sleeping.

Narrative: The deceased was mentally ill for two years. Sometimes he will leave home and walk long distances, without telling his mom or wife where he was going. In 1997 towards December he looked like he was getting better after he was treated by traditional healer. He was also treated at Tintswalo hospital and Agincourt health centre. After he seemed like he was feeling better he started refusing to take his medication (pills). However his family felt that he was well enough to go back to work In  January 1998. The family recommended that his wife must go and stay with him at work (nyaka dam) thats where he worked. They stayed for 3 months without problem. On the last week of March he started refusing to eat when his wife was sitting with him, he only ate when she left the room. On that week they came home and he started complaining about his stomach but he refused to go to clinic. His wife reported him to his mom and on the evening of his death, he got into a fight with his wife saying that she is a liar why did she  tell his mom that he (deceased) did not want to go to the clinic. His wife left that night and told his family. They decided to leave him alone. When they woke up the next morning they were told by neighbours that their son`s house was burn down. When they got there they only found him badly burned inside of the terrible burned house. Non one really knows what made him to do what he did.

Narrative: She woke up being healthy and went out to the field.  On her return.  She complained of dislocated joint in her foot. She said her ankles has been twisted.  The following morning she was unable to wake herself up and she told them that she was taken to Ireagh B to her sister to look after her because during the day nobody remains in the household.  But they were not aware that it may be a serious illness.  The leg was swollen and her sister used to boil water and make a cloth wet with hot water apply it to the swollen part leg.  After 5 days in Ireagh B the leg became black and she felt as if the leg was biting.  The following day a hole was formed underneath the big toes  and dirt was coming out of it.  Then is where they realised that she has been bewitched (xifulana).  Then they took her to a traditional healers whom they know him having  expertise in such disease.  The traditional healer put a hot medicine in a cloth and apply to the leg while hot.  When the traditional apply the cloth the deceased was feeling some pains as if there was something biting her.  The traditional healer was always washing the whole daily with medicine. The hole underneath was becoming big so one day the traditional healer washed the hole and opens the hole and squeeze to see what will come out.  So dirt came out eventually  big and living worms came out of seemed to be rotten.  He kept on washing and squeezing but the worms came in abundance and the hole became big.  Eventually the traditional healer surrendered.  He became scared even himself.  He said he had ever treated patients with such disease like this but not this one.  He even said he never met such things because what is coming out of the hole is not something was supposed to come from a living person.  It was after a week that they took her to tintswalo hospital.  She was then thin and could not eat.  They immediately met a Doctor.  The Doctor gave her two water drips after checking her.  The Doctor told the deceased's daughters that he must cut her leg if she must survive and the daughters agreed and say as long she is cured no problem  the Doctor told them that he do the cutting the following day.  In the middle of that night she died before the operation.

The traditional healer cut her on her legs with a razor and apply ointment on the cut spacer.  Also gave her powderly medicine to pour on water when bathing specially for legs.  So the legs became better.  Within a long time she started diarroea.  She was passing liquid stools with blood frequently.  She was taken matikwana hospital.  She was given tablets and drinking medicine.  After a mouth the diarrhoea stopped and discharged.  After three weeks four hospital her belly became swollen and it became big.  She was to eat little food. After few days she was taken o matikwana.  In matikwana they made a small hole just near her waist and the air came out down her belly.  She was well and discharged after two days.  After two weeks being at home the belly re-started to be swollen.  She was taken to tintswalo hospital.  In Tintswalo she was given an infection first and started draliling water from the belly.  The water was like a curry in colour and smelling badly.  She was well and discharged after 4 days.  She stayed a month being right at home.  The belly started for a third time so she was taken to tintswalo again.  She was redrained and the water was the same in colour as the first drained.  She was discharged and stayed at home for few days.  The belly started once more for the fourth time.  Then she taken to a traditional healer, who knows how to treat this type of illness completely in Edinburgh.  The traditional healer just gave her medicine to drink.  They she was well.  She stayed a full month being well in that traditional healer.  The traditional healer told her to stay another month to really make sure that the illness is completely cured.  She was then even able to cook for herself and the traditional hear.  When in the last week of the second month in that traditional healer.  When relatives were about to collect her, a miracle accured.  On the while she was busy cooking food on fire a frog jumped at her back and fell on fire.  So she told the traditional healer what she saw and happened.  So since the traditional healer was one legged.  She was unable to walk.  So the traditional healer told the deceased to remove the frog from fire.  So she took a stick and remove the frog from burning.  Within some few hours her right arm which removed the frog became swollen and painful and something developed in her chest first near her shoulder.  She was instantly taken to matikwana.  In matikwana they just gave her an injection and tablets and took her to ward for rest.  She died that night on the election day of 27 April 94.

Diagnosis was TB and in the middle of the illness cough became worse with vomit, eyes pale and was referred to Mankweng where he was taken to the Theatre, results being TB and lungs badly damaged.
